title: String or Binary Data would be truncated
text: This error message can pop up in multiple places within the system. In a simple term, it means that the data entered is too long for the database field so would be cut off. In this scenario the system will not let you save the entry. The most common places seen are when creating booking templates: The solution to this error is to shorten the description entered. If you are unsure which field is causing the error please contact the support team and send over the SQL error shown further down in the error box: The support team can then run this SQL error manually to determine which field is the problem if it's not stated in the error message.
description:
This error message can pop up in multiple places within the system. 


In a simple term, it means that the data entered is too long for the database field so would be cut off. In this scenario the system will not let you save the entry.


The most common places seen are when creating booking templates:



The solution to this error is to shorten the description entered. 


If you are unsure which field is causing the error please contact the support team and send over the SQL error shown further down in the error box:



The support team can then run this SQL error manually to determine which field is the problem if it's not stated in the error message.

title: Violation of Primary key constraint
text: If you are getting any error containing 'Violation of Primary Key constraint' please contact the support team This error message means the system is trying to overwrite an existing entry in the database and the support team will need to investigate why.
description:
If you are getting any error containing 'Violation of Primary Key constraint' please contact the support team

This error message means the system is trying to overwrite an existing entry in the database and the support team will need to investigate why.

title: Permission Denied Error
text: This Error generally occurs when the customer is trying to run a report and local permissions have not been set up on the device they are using, which is preventing the report on the device from being updated, before it can be run. Example of error: A Windows Administrator for the PC in question will have to perform the following steps in order to resolve this issue. Press the Windows key and the letter E key to open a File Explorer. Click into the top address bar (within red box labelled 1 below) and type in C:\ProgramData, and press the Enter key. Right-click on the Merac folder (labelled 2 above), and select Properties (labelled 2 above). Within the Properties window, click on the Security tab (labelled 4 below). Click Edit... (labelled 5 below), Add... (labelled 6 below), Type Everyone (labelled 7 below). Or at least users that will need use reports within the MStore Back Office. Click Check Names (labelled 8 below), OK (labelled 9 below). With Everyone selected, tick the Allow Full Control tick box (labelled 10 below). Click OK (labelled 11 below), Ok (labelled 12 below). You will now need to perform the same on the Merac folder within C:\Program Files (x86) (C:\Program Files if you have a 32-bit PC). Type in C:\Program Files (x86) (for 64-bit PC's) or C:\Program Files (for 32-bit PC's). Then follow steps 3-9 above. Once you have performed this, you will then be able to open reports within the MStore Back Office, without receiving a Permission denied error.
description:
This Error generally occurs when the customer is trying to run a report and local permissions have not been set up on the device they are using, which is preventing the report on the device from being updated, before it can be run.



Example of error:


A Windows Administrator for the PC in question will have to perform the following steps in order to resolve this issue.


  1. Press the Windows key and the letter E key to open a File Explorer.
  2. Click into the top address bar (within red box labelled 1 below) and type in C:\ProgramData, and press the Enter key. 
  3. Right-click on the Merac folder (labelled 2 above), and select Properties (labelled 2 above).
  4. Within the Properties window, click on the Security tab (labelled 4 below).
  5. Click Edit... (labelled 5 below), Add... (labelled 6 below), 
  6. Type Everyone (labelled 7 below). Or at least users that will need use reports within the MStore Back Office.
  7. Click Check Names (labelled 8 below), OK (labelled 9 below).
  8. With Everyone selected, tick the Allow Full Control tick box (labelled 10 below).
  9. Click OK (labelled 11 below), Ok (labelled 12 below).
  10. You will now need to perform the same on the Merac folder within C:\Program Files (x86) (C:\Program Files if you have a 32-bit PC). Type in C:\Program Files (x86) (for 64-bit PC's) or C:\Program Files (for 32-bit PC's).
  11. Then follow steps 3-9 above.



Once you have performed this, you will then be able to open reports within the MStore Back Office, without receiving a Permission denied error.

title: Till Datafile error
text: The Error below is an error that just warns the user that the Back office had not updated to the till in however many days listed. The solution to this error is to simply recreate the till data from the back office and update the tills. This will clear the error from coming up again.
description:
The Error below is an error that just warns the user that the Back office had not updated to the till in however many days listed. 





The solution to this error is to simply recreate the till data from the back office and update the tills. This will clear the error from coming up again.

title: Footfall completing against the year 2000
text: An issue reported recently was to do with footfall being recorded against the 01st Jan 2000 After some investigation it turns out that this is down to having 'Open Dated' ticked on the PLU where footfall is also included. If using footfall, you will need to remove the open dates tick box otherwise footfall will be recorded against an incorrect date and therefore the daily figures will be incorrect. (In this instance the support team can manually correct the footfall figures database side)
description:
An issue reported recently was to do with footfall being recorded against the 01st Jan 2000


After some investigation it turns out that this is down to having 'Open Dated' ticked on the PLU where footfall is also included. 



If using footfall, you will need to remove the open dates tick box otherwise footfall will be recorded against an incorrect date and therefore the daily figures will be incorrect. 


(In this instance the support team can manually correct the footfall figures database side)

title: Copying Sessions - Session created against the year 1899
text: When copying sessions you need to ensure the correct process is followed. Select the date the original session is set up. Click Copy. At this point you need to click 'Copy' again. If you click 'Paste' at this point, in some older versions the system will create an entry against the 1st Jan 1899! This has been corrected in more recent versions. When you click copy the system will then bring up a calendar to select which dates you wish to copy the session to: Select the relevant dates (turn green when selected): Apply. Click Paste at this point: The session will be copied to all selected dates:
description:
When copying sessions you need to ensure the correct process is followed. 


Select the date the original session is set up. 



Click Copy. 



At this point you need to click 'Copy' again. 


If you click 'Paste' at this point, in some older versions the system will create an entry against the 1st Jan 1899! 

This has been corrected in more recent versions.


When you click copy the system will then bring up a calendar to select which dates you wish to copy the session to:



Select the relevant dates (turn green when selected):



Apply. 


Click Paste at this point:



The session will be copied to all selected dates:

title: Unable to delete sessions when set to Exclusive / Not Available
text: If you have sessions set to 'Exclusive' or 'Not Available' and try to delete or cancel them, back office will not allow you to do so in more recent versions. This was put in place to resolve an issue raised from deleting sessions in this status. Solution: Update the session to make it 'Available' The system will then allow you to remove it or cancel it:
description:
If you have sessions set to 'Exclusive' or 'Not Available' and try to delete or cancel them, back office will not allow you to do so in more recent versions. This was put in place to resolve an issue raised from deleting sessions in this status. 


Solution:


Update the session to make it 'Available'



The system will then allow you to remove it or cancel it:

title: Unexpected error when logging into MStore back office
text: If you get the below error and the PC / Till is running Windows 7 it means the version of Windows 7 requires Windows updates. To resolve: If the till was originally provided by Merac / K3 the Windows updater service may have been disabled, this will need to be re-enabled and once started try again. If you get stuck at this point: Please contact support as we have a workaround. Alternately contact your IT support who will be able to resolve this for you. Once Windows 7 is up to date (It will require multiple restarts) please try again.
description:
If you get the below error and the PC / Till is running Windows 7 it means the version of Windows 7 requires Windows updates. 



To resolve:


If the till was originally provided by Merac / K3 the Windows updater service may have been disabled, this will need to be re-enabled and once started try again. 


If you get stuck at this point: 


Please contact support as we have a workaround. 

Alternately contact your IT support who will be able to resolve this for you. 


Once Windows 7 is up to date (It will require multiple restarts) please try again.

title: Updated version not pulling down after MStore update
text: If you have restarted the PC and the updated version has not pulled down correctly. 1. Please check the following Windows folder permissions: - C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac - C:\ProgramData\Merac Check if 'Everyone' has full control. If not, right click, security tab, add: Add 'Everyone' Set Everyone to 'Full control' Ok, to apply the change. Restart the Merac Updater service and it should pull the updated version down (Ensure that back office and the POS are closed as it won't be able to overwrite open files) 2. If this doesn't work, please contact MStore support and the team can connect in and update.
description:
If you have restarted the PC and the updated version has not pulled down correctly. 


1. Please check the following Windows folder permissions:


- C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac

- C:\ProgramData\Merac


Check if 'Everyone' has full control.

If not, right click, security tab, add:



Add 'Everyone'



Set Everyone to 'Full control'



Ok, to apply the change. 


Restart the Merac Updater service and it should pull the updated version down (Ensure that back office and the POS are closed as it won't be able to overwrite open files)


2. If this doesn't work, please contact MStore support and the team can connect in and update.

title: Receipt designer not opening
text: If the Back Office program looks as though it freezes/crashed when launching the Receipt Designer. Browse to C:\ProgramFiles(x86)\Merac and search for VisualBasicPowerPacksSetup.exe Run the setup and follow the instructions on screen. Double check that ReceiptDesigner.exe is visible, both located in C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac. Customers IT may need to perform this if this requires a Windows Administrator. .Net Framework 3.5 is also required for this program to run. But Windows would usual prompt to install this if this is the case. In this instance you will get an error as below (ReceiptDesign.exe would be shown). .NET can be installed easily from Programs and Features. The easiest way is to enable .Net 3.5 from Windows Features: This might require a restart of the PC to install.
description:
If the Back Office program looks as though it freezes/crashed when launching the Receipt Designer. 


Browse to C:\ProgramFiles(x86)\Merac and search for VisualBasicPowerPacksSetup.exe 


Run the setup and follow the instructions on screen.


Double check that  ReceiptDesigner.exe is visible, both located in C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac. 

Customers IT may need to perform this if this requires a Windows Administrator. 

â€¯ 

.Net Framework 3.5 is also required for this program to run. But Windows would usual prompt to install this if this is the case. 


In this instance you will get an error as below (ReceiptDesign.exe would be shown). 


.NET can be installed easily from Programs and Features. The easiest way is to enable .Net 3.5 from Windows Features:



 
This might require a restart of the PC to install.

title: Unable to scan barcodes from online booking confirmations
text: Previously we have had sites report that the barcode will not scan if the background colour on the email confirmations is a dark colour. In the instance logged the background was dark grey. If there is a colour set here: It will be overridden by whatever is set here: (For reference #ffffff is white, screenshot taken after this was updated) Modify the colour (if you are unsure of the hex, you can use a colour chart online which will give you the correct value). Ensure you save the changes.
description:
Previously we have had sites report that the barcode will not scan if the background colour on the email confirmations is a dark colour. 


In the instance logged the background was dark grey. 


If there is a colour set here:



It will be overridden by whatever is set here:


(For reference #ffffff is white, screenshot taken after this was updated)




Modify the colour (if you are unsure of the hex, you can use a colour chart online which will give you the correct value).


Ensure you save the changes.

title: How to check if you have stuck transactions
text: If you think that your site may have stuck transactions and want to know, follow the below to check for signs of this. First you check the Till screen in the back office for signs. The most obvious sign will be an open till drawer for a till in use that has been opened days/month in the past. If you open and close the cash drawers daily this will be a big sign of stuck transactions. You can also check the that the draw number on the till in the tills screen matches the one in use on the till. Another sign is that if you open the till details and there are zero transactions and figures processed through the till. This is a sign that your till is not sending the transactions to the database or that they are stuck in the SQL table. Incorrect Till and not uploading. Correct till and up to date.
description:
If you think that your site may have stuck transactions and want to know, follow the below to check for signs of this. 


First you check the Till screen in the back office for signs. The most obvious sign will be an open till drawer for a till in use that has been opened days/month in the past. If you open and close the cash drawers daily this will be a big sign of stuck transactions. 


You can also check the that the draw number on the till in the tills screen matches the one in use on the till.


Another sign is that if you open the till details and there are zero transactions and figures processed through the till. This is a sign that your till is not sending the transactions to the database or that they are stuck in the SQL table. 


Incorrect Till and not uploading. 



Correct till and up to date.

title: Completing bookings via the outstanding bookings tool
text: When completing bookings via the outstanding bookings tool, the booking in question MUST have a valid price break for the day of booking. If completed for a day there is NOT a valid price break, the system will not pick up the correct VAT rate and anything set as standard rate VAT (or any other VAT rate) will be recorded as Z and zero vat amount. Completed via O/S bookings, no valid price for the day of booking: Completed via O/S bookings, valid price for the day of booking:
description:
When completing bookings via the outstanding bookings tool, the booking in question MUST have a valid price break for the day of booking. 



If completed for a day there is NOT a valid price break, the system will not pick up the correct VAT rate and anything set as standard rate VAT (or any other VAT rate) will be recorded as Z and zero vat amount.


Completed via O/S bookings, no valid price for the day of booking:



Completed via O/S bookings, valid price for the day of booking:

title: Barcodes printing as text
text: If you have set up a barcode to print out via receipt designer and the barcode is coming out as text! It generally means the PC / till you are trying to print from doesn't have the required barcodes installed. The most common barcode fonts are 3of9 and code128 Please install the attached barcodes and try again. (Extract the zip file and just run each file one by one which will install them) Any problems please contact the support team.
description:
If you have set up a barcode to print out via receipt designer and the barcode is coming out as text! It generally means the PC / till you are trying to print from doesn't have the required barcodes installed. 


The most common barcode fonts are 3of9 and code128



Please install the attached barcodes and try again. 


(Extract the zip file and just run each file one by one which will install them)


Any problems please contact the support team.
